MEMORANDUM
TO: NAEB Board of Directors
FROM: Harold E. Hill
DATE: December 15, 1961
It is time to elect a chairman for the Board of Directors for 1962.
Under the new policy adopted by the Board at its last meeting, the Chainaan of
the Board is to be elected annually, by mail, from among those who have had one
year1 s experience on the Board TJithin the past five years, 'foe number of terms
which he may ser/e as chairman is not limited.
Attached is a list of the newly constituted Board, and below is a coupon for you
to fill out and return to me. Since we cannot elect the chairmen of the Radio
Board and TV Board until after the chairman of the full Board is elected (to avoid
any possible duplication), and since we would like to have all three Chairmen
elected shortly after the first of the year, will you please return the ballot to
me no later than December 26?
As agreed by the Board, there will be no formal procedure of nomination, followed
by election. Rather, each member is asked to vote for the one he prefers for chairÂ¬
man. The one getting the most votes (a plurality is all that is required) will be
elected. In case of a tie, a run-off will be held among those tied.
Mr. Harold E. Hill
